chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maxwell A Colletti

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 30, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

8:58 AM Defendant Maxwell A Colletti appeared by video.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Maxwell A Colletti.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Griffis is requesting a new date for plea and sentencing in January.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

9:38 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Kristi Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Maxwell A Colletti.  
Defendant Maxwell A Colletti not in court and his appearance is waived.
Attorney Griffis requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:37 AM File not called on the record.
Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court by zoom with attorney Justin G Griffis. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Griffis requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:46 AM Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griffis states his client wishes to waive the preliminary hearing. 
Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant wavies his right to a preliminary hearing. 
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information. 
Defense accepts filing of the information, wavies reading.
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to have no contact with victim A (unless they initiate contact or in an emergency fashion) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:20 PM Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
